DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the effectiveness and safety of indacaterol with salmeterol /fluticasone propionate treatment in patients with moderate chronic obstructive pulmonary disease who, on entry to the study are being treated with salmeterol /fluticasone propionate.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Indacaterol 150 mcg Once Daily (o.d.) With Salmeterol/Fluticasone Propionate 50 mcg/500 mcg Twice Daily (b.i.d.)
DOC.criteria: Patients with moderate COPD (Stage II) Able to perform spirometry assessments Current or exsmokers On treatment with the fixeddose combination of salmeterol 50 µg/fluticasone propionate 500 µg MDDPI b.i.d. for the treatment of COPD for ≥ 3 months directly preceding Visit 1. Having had a COPD exacerbation that required treatment with antibiotics and/or oral corticosteroids and/or hospitalization in the past year. Having a history of, or current ECG abnormality Asthma Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.
